Finish test
Let\'s go
Test Instructions

- You can answer the questions in any order you wish, use the buttons below to navigate between questions. \n- You can leave questions unanswered, but we recommend that you answer as many questions as possible. \n- If you haven\'t selected a maximum time limit for the test, you can take as long as you need. If you have selected one, the timer will start counting down when you close this window.
Are you tired too?

We feel the same way, take a break and come back whenever you want.\nIf you think you\'ll take too long and don\'t want to lose your progress, we recommend saving your progress.\nYou can open the app at any time and we will preserve the state of the test.
Save Progress

Reasoning
Cognitive Processing

Management and Organizational
Logical Reasoning
Evaluation of basic logical and mathematical inferences
Focus on problems involving numerical relationships and distances
Evaluation of understanding relationships between elements and mathematical rules
Questions on divisibility and distributions
Verification of understanding of numerical sequences and divisibility
Solving logical pattern problems (series and analogies)
Analysis of statements and deduction of conclusions
Problems of classification and grouping based on logical features
Verbal Reasoning
Evaluation of reading comprehension and deduction of inferences
Analysis and solving of verbal analogies
Identification of relationships between words or phrases
Solving word puzzles and word games
Evaluation of coherence and cohesion in complex texts
Evaluation of implicit and explicit inferences
Identification of antonyms, synonyms, and contextual meanings
Solving problems related to verbal analogies and semantic relationships
Numerical Reasoning
Solving basic mathematical operations
Evaluation of numerical patterns
Evaluation of numerical sequences and progressions
Calculations of percentages, proportions, and fractions
Solving basic algebra and equations problems
Evaluation of understanding magnitudes and numerical scales
Identification of relationships between different numerical sets
Solving problems involving estimation and rounding of numbers
Spatial Perception
Evaluation of the ability to visualize and manipulate objects in space
Identification of geometric figures and their properties
Evaluation of spatial orientation and rotation of objects
Analysis of maps and diagrams
Recognition of patterns in three-dimensional structures
Comparison of figures and objects in different planes
Tasks of visualizing 3D objects from 2D representations
Evaluation of abilities to solve spatial puzzles
Memory
Evaluation of short-term memory
Tests of visual and auditory memory
Recall of sequences of numbers or words
Evaluation of working memory
Tasks of memorization and pattern recognition
Evaluation of the ability to recall details from stories or texts
Memory for spatial and visual locations
Recognition of previously presented information
Attention and Concentration
Evaluation of the ability to maintain attention on prolonged tasks
Tests of concentration under distractions
Evaluation of the ability to detect details in repetitive tasks
Evaluation of divided attention
Evaluation of concentration under time pressure
Tasks of visual and auditory vigilance
Solving tasks that require maintaining focus on multiple elements
Evaluation of resistance to cognitive fatigue in concentration tasks
Processing Speed
Quick reaction tasks to visual and auditory stimuli
Speed tests in basic math operations resolution
Evaluation of response time in pattern identification
Text or image processing exercises under time pressure
Evaluation of quick decision-making under time limit situations
Rapid comparison and classification of symbols or numbers
Processing speed tests in word or letter sequences
Evaluation of speed in detecting subtle differences between images
Abstract Reasoning
Identification of complex patterns and abstract relationships
Evaluation of set logic and abstract relationships
Solving problems with abstract sequences and figures
Deduction of rules in non-numeric and non-verbal sequences
Analysis of advanced geometric patterns and abstract symbols
Evaluation of reasoning capacity in non-concrete concepts
Comparison of abstract diagrams to identify similarities and differences
Exercises in identifying patterns in geometric series
Stress Resilience
Evaluation of capacity to maintain performance under pressure
Quick decision tasks under high-pressure situations
Tests for adaptation to unexpected situations or sudden changes
Measurement of frustration tolerance in challenging tasks
Tests of perseverance in prolonged and challenging tasks
Evaluation of cognitive load and emotional pressure management
Simulation of repetitive tasks with increasing difficulty
Evaluation of emotional self-regulation in stressful stimuli
Visual Motor Skills
Eye-hand coordination tasks (e.g., drawing figures under instruction)
Precision tests in piece assembly tasks
Evaluation of fine motor skills in manipulation tasks
Visual tracking tasks for moving objects
Tests of speed and precision in tactile and visual responses
Precision tasks in visual pattern reproduction
Quick response exercises to visual-tactile stimuli
Evaluation of skills for tracing following complex patterns
Planning and Organization Skills
Evaluation of skills to order and prioritize tasks
Exercises in goal setting and sequential steps
Tests of problem-solving requiring strategy
Planning sequences to reach a given goal
Tasks for organizing elements in a logical order
Evaluation of the ability to adapt and adjust plans as needed
Exercises in solving sequential puzzles or mazes
Tests of resource organization and allocation in simulated situations
Decision Making
Evaluation of logical decision-making under uncertainty or pressure
Tests of prioritization and selection among options with multiple variables
Tasks in ethical or practical decision-making
Evaluation of decisions in contexts with conflicts of interest
Simulations of scenarios requiring rapid decision-making
Analysis of long-term consequences in decision-making
Evaluation of decision-making with incomplete or ambiguous information
Selection exercises under time and resource constraints
Creativity
Divergent thinking tests to generate multiple solutions
Exercises in fluency and originality of ideas or concepts
Evaluation of the ability to see unusual connections among elements
Creative problem-solving within specific constraints
Exercises in inventiveness for creating novel products or ideas
Evaluation of ability to modify traditional approaches to new situations
Creative visualization tasks for solving complex problems
Creative writing exercises in hypothetical situations
Mechanical Comprehension
Evaluation of understanding of mechanical and physical principles
Spatial reasoning tests with moving objects
Understanding of motion laws, such as gravity and friction
Evaluation of simple mechanisms (levers, pulleys, gears, etc.)
Identification of physical principles in machines and devices
Exercises in predicting outcomes in mechanical scenarios
Analysis of basic electrical circuits and their components
Evaluation of understanding of complex systems and how they work
Problem Solving
Evaluation of skills in analyzing problems with multiple variables
Tests in problem-solving requiring logical and critical steps
Problem-solving exercises with resource or information limitations
Evaluation of ability to think of alternative solutions in high-complexity contexts
Problem-solving exercises requiring nonlinear, multi-step strategy
Tasks involving reorganizing information and seeking patterns
Problem-solving in hypothetical scenarios with multiple variables
Evaluation of ability to solve problems under changing conditions

Exercises in conflict resolution in interpersonal situations

Tasks of emotional self-control in stressful situations
